chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory A. Pfingsten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in fulltime employment, schooling, or a combination of the two, and when not fully engaged complete 5 hours community service per week.

Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
Complete Sex Offender treatment and that includes Denyer's group treatmetn.
Complete with Sex Offender registry for 15 years.
DNA sample w/ surcharge,

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I&S 9 months for rule violations. With huber release for work, school, or treatment if defendant meets jail criteria. 45 days to report.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory A. Pfingsten

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 3:13pm
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer; Deft appears in person with Atty Dave Casey.
Date and time set for sentencing hearing

State gives history of case and previous hearing was to request PSI
State says PSI recommendation was less than they recommend
Atty Casey in agreement with PSI report
State makes argument regarding sentencing
Atty Casey makes argument on sentencing
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 10 years probation. Imposing 1 year MCJ, Impose and stay 9 months for rule violations. Huber release for work, school, or treatment if meets jail criteria. Deft has 45 days to report to jail. 
CONDITIONS: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed necessary by agent. Complete sex offender treatment, and includes denyer's group treatment. Comply with sex offender registry for 15 years. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of the two, when not fully engaged complete 5 hours of community service per week. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Not approving electronic monitor programming. 3 days jail credit given. Cash bond posted to be returned to defendant once goes towards DNA sample and cc.

Adj: 2:03 pm

Includes 15CF742 and 14CF893.    No contact with children under the age of 18.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  No internet or computer at all unless at work and only for work purposes.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Plea hearing on May 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection

AMENDED No contact with children under 18 years of age. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. May only use computer during the course of his work but cannot use the internet.
